url.imageAlt: An old photo of JP’s Disco, a large white warehouse looking building, with the original signage still intact
A black and white photo of the hotel signage hanging above the entrance reading “West Side House”
A black and white photo of a construction vehicle tearing down JP’s Disco

description: From 1974 to 1981, this was the West Side Hotel. It later served as JP's Disco from 1979 to 1988. Vicki Charles won the first Miss Gay Windsor here in 1982. In 1983, it held the first Gay/Lesbian international celebration in North America, entitled United for Freedom: Lesbian and Gay Freedom Day (Detroit/Windsor).
